name: BBQ Chicken & Sweet Potato
description: Juicy chicken coated in homemade BBQ sauce, paired with caramelized sweet potatoes. A high-protein, balanced meal.

instructions.instruction: Prepare the BBQ sauce: Mix tomato paste, apple cider vinegar, honey, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.
instructions.tip: Homemade sauce is lower in sugar and salt.

instructions.instruction: Toss sweet potato cubes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread sweet potatoes on a baking sheet. Roast for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, season chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat remaining oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Sear chicken for 3 minutes per side.
Brush BBQ sauce over chicken. Add to the baking sheet with sweet potatoes.
Roast for another 15-20 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce caramelizes.
Steam or blanch broccoli for 3-4 minutes.
Serve chicken with sweet potatoes and broccoli.

tips: Sweet potatoes provide complex carbs with a low glycemic index.
Perfect for carb-loading before endurance training.
Meal prep friendly - stores well for 4 days.
Double the BBQ sauce recipe and store for future use.
storageInfo: Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 4 days. Reheat in the oven for best results.
servingSuggestion: Pair with a fresh green salad or coleslaw.
variations: Chicken breast can also be used but reduce cooking time.
